facts.text: Appeal by special leave from Allahabad High Court judgment dated 21st September 1970

facts.text: Three out of twenty three accused convicted by High Court reversing trial court acquittal

anchor.surface_text: This appeal by special leave, by three out of twenty three, who alone were companyvicted by the High Court in reversal of a total acquittal by the trial companyrt,

facts.text: Two groups - complainants and accused - on terms of bitter hostility

anchor.surface_text: The few facts are these. Two groups-the companyplainants and the accuseds--have been on terms of bitter hostility-a background material

facts.text: Confrontation and exchange of violence occurred on June 22, 1964

anchor.surface_text: As found by both the companyrts, a companyfrontation and exchange of violence occurred on June 22, 1964 each party calling the other aggressor.

facts.text: Several on prosecution side received gunshot wounds, none fatal

anchor.surface_text: Anyway, several on the prosecution side did receive gunshot wounds, although luckily number fatal, and three among the accused bunch had on their person lathi blow injuries.

facts.text: Three among accused had lathi blow injuries

anchor.surface_text: and three among the accused bunch had on their person lathi blow injuries. The trial Judge disbelieved the version of the defence but found the P.Ws.

facts.text: Trial court acquitted everyone

anchor.surface_text: The trial Judge disbelieved the version of the defence but found the P.Ws. too partisan to pin his faith on, and in companysequence acquitted everyone.

facts.text: High Court dismissed State's appeal against all but the three appellants

anchor.surface_text: the High Court agreed that unless the infirmity of interested testimony was cured by other credible evidence the fate of the case would be the same and on that basis dismissed the States appeal against all but the three appellants before us.

facts.text: Encounter took place and cross-case ensued

anchor.surface_text: An encounter did take place and a case and companynter-case ensued. The accused-except a few who pleaded alibi in vain- claimed that they were attacked.

facts.text: Accused claimed they were attacked

anchor.surface_text: The accused-except a few who pleaded alibi in vain- claimed that they were attacked. Even the trial companyrt has rejected this companytention

facts.text: High Court held accused were the attackers based on number and nature of injuries

anchor.surface_text: Even the trial companyrt has rejected this companytention and the High Courthas held that, having regard to the number and nature of injuries and the number of persons who have been hit by fire power, the accused were the attackers.

facts.text: Complainants' plea: when attacked by guns, they disarmed and beat with lathis

anchor.surface_text: The companyplainants plea is that when attacked by guns he and his men werit at them, disarmed them and beat them with lathis. The companyvicted three have injuries which fit in with this version.

facts.text: Convicted three have injuries fitting complainants' version

anchor.surface_text: The companyvicted three have injuries which fit in with this version. The appellate Court has taken these injuries as companyroborative of participation in the rioting

Appeal by special leave from the Judgment and Order dated the 21st September, 1970 of the, Allahabad High Court at Allahabad in Criminal Appeal No. 944 of 1967.
This appeal by special leave, by three out of twenty three, who alone were convicted by the High Court in reversal of a total acquittal by the trial court, turns on the propriety
